query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Mentre che sì per l’orlo, uno innanzi altro, 2 ce n’andavamo, e spesso il buon maestro 3 diceami: «Guarda: giovi ch’io ti scaltro»;
query.error: **English:** 1 While thus along the edge, one in front of the other, 2 we went our way, and often the good master 3 said to me: "Look, it is good that I make you wise";

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 feriami il sole in su l’omero destro, 5 che già, raggiando, tutto l’occidente 6 mutava in bianco aspetto di cilestro;
query.error: **English:** 4 the sun was striking me on my right shoulder, 5 which, with its rays, was already changing all the west 6 into a white aspect from blue;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 e io facea con l’ombra più rovente 8 parer la fiamma; e pur a tanto indizio 9 vidi molt’ ombre, andando, poner mente.
query.error: **English:** 7 and I, with my shadow, made the flame 8 seem more ardent; and yet by that sign alone 9 I saw many shades, as we went, taking note.
query.result: 7 and ic mid ðære sceade geworhte ðæt fyr 8 ðuhte ða swiðor byrnende; and þeah ðurh ðæt tacen ana 9 ic geseah fela sceada, þa we forð gewendon, georne behealdan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Questa fu la cagion che diede inizio 11 loro a parlar di me; e cominciarsi 12 a dir: «Colui non par corpo fittizio»;
query.error: **English:** 10 This was the cause that gave them the beginning 11 to speak of me; and they began 12 to say: "That one does not seem a fictitious body";

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 poi verso me, quanto potëan farsi, 14 certi si fero, sempre con riguardo 15 di non uscir dove non fosser arsi.
query.error: **English:** 13 then toward me, as much as they could come, 14 some made themselves certain, always with caution 15 of not coming out where they would not be burned.
query.result: 13 ða to me weard, swa ða meahton furðum, 14 sume georne, symble ðæs georne 15 ðæt hie ne come ofer ðær ða fyr wæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 «O tu che vai, non per esser più tardo, 17 ma forse reverente, a li altri dopo, 18 rispondi a me che ’n sete e ’n foco ardo.
query.error: **English:** 16 "O you who go, not to be slower, 17 but perhaps reverent, after the others, 18 answer me who burn in thirst and fire.
query.result: 16 "Eala ðu ðe gæst, nis ðe for ði ðæt ðu sie æfter ðinum geferum lætra, 17 ac for ði ðæt ðu sie æfter him arwurðlicra, 18 andwyrde me ðe on ðyrste and on fyre bærne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Né solo a me la tua risposta è uopo; 20 ché tutti questi n’hanno maggior sete 21 che d’acqua fredda Indo o Etïopo.
query.error: **English:** 19 Nor is your answer needed by me alone; 20 for all these have a greater thirst for it 21 than Indians or Ethiopians have for cold water.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Dinne com’ è che fai di te parete 23 al sol, pur come tu non fossi ancora 24 di morte intrato dentro da la rete».
query.error: **English:** 22 Tell me, how is it that you make a wall of yourself 23 to the sun, just as if you had not yet 24 entered the net of death?
query.result: 22 Saga me, hu ðu ðurh ðe ðone weall geworhtest 23 ongean ðone sunnan, swa ðu nære gyt 24 on ðære deades net ðurh ðone gripe gangen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Sì mi parlava un d’essi; e io mi fora 26 già manifesto, s’io non fossi atteso 27 ad altra novità ch’apparve allora;
query.error: **English:** 25 Thus one of them spoke to me; and I would have already 26 revealed myself, if I had not been waiting 27 for another new thing that appeared then;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 ché per lo mezzo del cammino acceso 29 venne gente col viso incontro a questa, 30 la qual mi fece a rimirar sospeso.
query.error: **English:** 28 for in the middle of the narrow path 29 came people with faces opposite these, 30 who made me pause to look at them.
query.result: 28 forðæm ðurh ðæs wudu midde wegas 29 com folc ðam oðrum on gean mid andwlitum, 30 ða ðe me wundredon ða ic ða geseah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Lì veggio d’ogne parte farsi presta 32 ciascun’ ombra e basciarsi una con una 33 sanza restar, contente a brieve festa;
query.error: **English:** 31 There I see on every side making haste 32 each shade, and kissing one another 33 without stopping, content with a brief festival;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 così per entro loro schiera bruna 35 s’ammusa l’una con l’altra formica, 36 forse a spïar lor via e lor fortuna.
query.error: **English:** 34 thus within their brown troop 35 one ant noses another, 36 perhaps to inquire about their way and their fortune.
query.result: 34 swa ðurh hyra brune gesceapu 35 æmettan oðer oðerne nosað, 36 mæðe to ascian hyra weg and hyra gesælde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Tosto che parton l’accoglienza amica, 38 prima che ’l primo passo lì trascorra, 39 sopragridar ciascuna s’affatica:
query.error: **English:** 37 As soon as they part from the friendly welcome, 38 before the first step is taken there, 39 each one strives to outshout the other:
query.result: 37 Swa raðe swa ða freondlice onfengas tosceadað, 38 ærðon ðe ðær ðæs forman fæðmes ofergangan wære, 39 ða ongan æghwilc oðerne oferhludan:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 la nova gente: «Soddoma e Gomorra»; 41 e l’altra: «Ne la vacca entra Pasife, 42 perché ’l torello a sua lussuria corra».
query.error: **English:** 40 the new people: “Sodom and Gomorrah”; 41 and the other: “Pasiphaë enters the cow, 42 so that the bull may run to her lust”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Poi, come grue ch’a le montagne Rife 44 volasser parte, e parte inver’ l’arene, 45 queste del gel, quelle del sole schife,
query.error: **English:** 43 Then, like cranes that fly in a long line 44 some towards the mountains, some towards the sands, 45 these fleeing the cold, those the sun,
query.result: 43 Þa, swa swa cranas ðe to muntum Rifæum 44 fleogað sumne dæl, and sumne to ðam morlande, 45 þas ðæs cealdan, þas ðæs sunnan fleoð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 e raccostansi a me, come davanti, 50 essi medesmi che m’avean pregato, 51 attenti ad ascoltar ne’ lor sembianti.
query.error: **English:** 49 and they gather around me, as before, 50 the same ones who had asked me, 51 attentive to listen in their expressions.
query.result: 49 and genealæcað me, swa swa ær, 50 ða ylcan ðe me ær bædon, 51 georne to gehyranne on heora gesceapum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Io, che due volte avea visto lor grato, 53 incominciai: «O anime sicure 54 d’aver, quando che sia, di pace stato,
query.error: **English:** 52 I, who had seen their pleasant aspect twice, 53 began: "O souls secure 54 of having, whenever it may be, a state of peace,
query.result: 52 Ic, ðe twegen siðum hæfde gesewen heora wlite, 53 ongan ða sprecan: "Eala, sawla gesælige, 54 ðæs ðe ge habbað, hwanne hit sie, sibbe staðol,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 non son rimase acerbe né mature 56 le membra mie di là, ma son qui meco 57 col sangue suo e con le sue giunture.
query.error: **English:** 55 my limbs have not remained bitter nor ripe 56 on the other side, but they are here with me 57 with their blood and with their joints.
query.result: 55 ne synt gewitene bitre ne geðigene 56 mine limu ðær, ac synt her mid me 57 mid heora blode and mid heora geðwærum."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Quinci sù vo per non esser più cieco; 59 donna è di sopra che m’acquista grazia, 60 per che ’l mortal per vostro mondo reco.
query.error: **English:** 58 Hence I go up so as not to be blind any more; 59 a lady is above who acquires grace for me, 60 for which I gather the mortal through your world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Ma se la vostra maggior voglia sazia 62 tosto divegna, sì che ’l ciel v’alberghi 63 ch’è pien d’amore e più ampio si spazia,
query.error: **English:** 61 But if your greater desire is soon sated, 62 so that Heaven may receive you, 63 which is full of love and extends more widely,
query.result: 61 Ac gif ðin mæste wilnunga sona geweorðe, 62 swa ðæt ðe heofonum onfenge, 63 ðe is full of lufe and bradore rume,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 ditemi, acciò ch’ancor carte ne verghi, 65 chi siete voi, e chi è quella turba 66 che se ne va di retro a’ vostri terghi».
query.error: **English:** 64 tell me, so that I may still write it down, 65 who you are, and who is that crowd 66 that goes behind your backs."
query.result: 64 sege me, ðæt ic ða gyt write on bocum, 65 hwa ðu sy and hwa ðæt folc sy 66 ðe ðe folgað æfter ðinum hrycge."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Non altrimenti stupido si turba 68 lo montanaro, e rimirando ammuta, 69 quando rozzo e salvatico s’inurba,

query.result: 67 Nis ðæs wundorlicor ðæs muntmannes mod, 68 ðonne he gesihð ðone seld sellicre, 69 ðonne he ðurh ðone wudu wælgrim cymeð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 che ciascun’ ombra fece in sua paruta; 71 ma poi che furon di stupore scarche, 72 lo qual ne li alti cuor tosto s’attuta,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 73 "Eala ðu gesælig, ðe of ðissum mearce," 74 ða eft ongan ðæt wif ðe ær me befrægn, 75 "for ði ðe ðu bettre deðe gebidan most!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 La gente che non vien con noi, offese 77 di ciò per che già Cesar, trïunfando, 78 “Regina” contra sé chiamar s’intese:
query.error: **English:** 76 The people who do not come with us offended 77 by that for which Caesar, triumphing, 78 heard himself called "Queen" against his will:
query.result: 76 Þæt folc ðe ne cymeð mid us, hit is forðæmed 77 ðurh ðæt ðe ða Iulius, ða he sige hæfde, 78 "Cwen" ongean hine sylfne nemned gehyrde:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 però si parton “Soddoma” gridando, 80 rimproverando a sé com’ hai udito, 81 e aiutan l’arsura vergognando.
query.error: **English:** 79 therefore they depart crying "Sodom," 80 reproaching themselves as you have heard, 81 and help their burning by being ashamed.
query.result: 79 for ði hi farð fram, "Sodoma" cleopiende, 80 ða synna him sylfum asmeagende, 81 and ða bryne mid ðam hreowe gehelpð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Nostro peccato fu ermafrodito; 83 ma perché non servammo umana legge, 84 seguendo come bestie l’appetito,
query.error: **English:** 82 Our sin was hermaphroditic; 83 but because we did not observe human law, 84 following our appetites like beasts,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 in obbrobrio di noi, per noi si legge, 86 quando partinci, il nome di colei 87 che s’imbestiò ne le ’mbestiate schegge.
query.error: **English:** 85 to our shame, for our sake is read, 86 when you depart, the name of her 87 who thrust herself into the bestial splinters.
query.result: 85 on bysmor us, for us is gerædd, 86 ðonne ðu gewindest, ðæs wifmannes nama 87 ðe hire onstyrede on ða bestiallican splintru.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Or sai nostri atti e di che fummo rei: 89 se forse a nome vuo’ saper chi semo, 90 tempo non è di dire, e non saprei.
query.error: **English:** 88 Now you know our deeds and what we were kings of: 89 if perhaps you want to know who we are by name, 90 it is not time to tell, and I would not know how.
query.result: 88 Nu ðu wast ure dæda and hwas we rixuðon: 89 gif ðu wilt witan nu ðurh naman hwa we sindon, 90 nis ðis ðæs tid ne ic hit ðe secgan ne cann.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Farotti ben di me volere scemo: 92 son Guido Guinizzelli, e già mi purgo 93 per ben dolermi prima ch’a lo stremo».
query.result:
**English:**
91 I will make you want to know about me: 92 I am Guido Guinizzelli, and I already cleanse myself 93 for grieving well before the end.
**Old English:**
91 Ic wille ðe wel cunnian to me: 92 ic eom Guido Guinizzelli, and ic me nu clænsie 93 ðurh ðæt ic wel reowsige ær ðæm ende.
(Note: The word "cunnian" in Old English means "to make known" or "to inform.")

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Quali ne la tristizia di Ligurgo 95 si fer due figli a riveder la madre, 96 tal mi fec’ io, ma non a tanto insurgo,
query.error: **English:** 94 As in the sadness of Lycurgus 95 two sons made themselves to see their mother again, 96 so did I, but I do not rise to such a height,
query.result: 94 Swa on ðære sorgum Lycurgus 95 twegen suna ða modor eft gesohton, 96 swa dyde ic, ac na swa micel ne dorste,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 quand’ io odo nomar sé stesso il padre 98 mio e de li altri miei miglior che mai 99 rime d’amore usar dolci e leggiadre;
query.error: **English:** 97 when I hear my father name himself 98 and my other best ones who never 99 used sweet and graceful love poems;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 e sanza udire e dir pensoso andai 101 lunga fïata rimirando lui, 102 né, per lo foco, in là più m’appressai.
query.error: **English:** 100 and without hearing and speaking I went thoughtfully 101 for a long time looking back at him, 102 nor, because of the fire, did I draw any nearer.
query.result: 100 and butan hyran and secgan ða sorhfull 101 lange hwile hine eft beheold, 102 ne, for ðam fyre, ne dorste ic furðor gangan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Poi che di riguardar pasciuto fui, 104 tutto m’offersi pronto al suo servigio 105 con l’affermar che fa credere altrui.
query.error: **English:** 103 After I had fed my eyes with gazing, 104 I offered myself completely to his service 105 with the affirmation that makes others believe.
query.result: 103 Þa ic ðæs wlitigan weorces wæs 104 eagum þurhsewen, ða ic me sona gearwade 105 mid ðære spræce ðe soðfæste geleafað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Ed elli a me: «Tu lasci tal vestigio, 107 per quel ch’i’ odo, in me, e tanto chiaro, 108 che Letè nol può tòrre né far bigio.
query.error: **English:** 106 And he said to me: "You leave such a trace, 107 from what I hear, in me, and so clear, 108 that Lethe cannot take it away or make it dim.
query.result: 106 And he sæde to me: "Þu læfst swylcne wæstm, 107 for ðæm ðe ic gehýre, on me, and swa scírne, 108 ðæt Lethe ne mæg ðone ádon né gedón fæcne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Ma se le tue parole or ver giuraro, 110 dimmi che è cagion per che dimostri 111 nel dire e nel guardar d’avermi caro».
query.error: **English:** 109 But if your words now swear truly, 110 tell me what is the reason that you show 111 in your words and in your gaze that you hold me dear.
query.result: 109 Ac gif ðine word nu soð giurað, 110 sege me hwet ðe on mode sie 111 on ðinum wordum and on ðinum gesihðum ðæt ðu me lufige.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 E io a lui: «Li dolci detti vostri, 113 che, quanto durerà l’uso moderno, 114 faranno cari ancora i loro incostri».
query.error: **English:** 112 And I to him: "Your sweet words, 113 which, as long as modern usage shall endure, 114 will make their ink precious still."
query.result: 112 And ic to him: "Þine swetan word, 113 ðe, swa lange swa ðæs nales bruc ðurhwunað, 114 wyrðað ðara inc ðara word georne."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 «O frate», disse, «questi ch’io ti cerno 116 col dito», e additò un spirto innanzi, 117 «fu miglior fabbro del parlar materno.
query.error: **English:** 115 "O brother," he said, "this one whom I point out to you 116 with my finger," and he pointed to a spirit in front of us, 117 "was a better craftsman of the mother tongue.
query.result: 115 "Eala, broðor," cwæð he, "ðes ðe ic ðe cyðe 116 mid ðam fingre," and ða fremede gast, 117 "wæs ðara worda welhwylc wyrsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Versi d’amore e prose di romanzi 119 soverchiò tutti; e lascia dir li stolti 120 che quel di Lemosì credon ch’avanzi.
query.error: **English:** 118 Verses of love and prose romances 119 he surpassed them all; and let the fools say 120 that they believe the one from Limoges is better.
query.result: 118 Lēoðum deorlice and lāre spellum 119 oferfêng ealle; and lātað ðā dwola 120 ðā þe Lemoisin secgað þæt he selra wære.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 A voce più ch’al ver drizzan li volti, 122 e così ferman sua oppinïone 123 prima ch’arte o ragion per lor s’ascolti.
query.error: **English:** 121 With their voices louder than the truth, they direct their faces, 122 and thus they establish their opinion 123 before art or reason is heard by them.
query.result: 121 Mid stefnum stiðum ðonne ða wælræsas 122 fæstnodan fyrde; næfre hi forht ne wæs 123 on ðam wælstenge wiges heardne ræs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Così fer molti antichi di Guittone, 125 di grido in grido pur lui dando pregio, 126 fin che l’ha vinto il ver con più persone.
query.error: **English:** 124 Thus did many of Guittone's elders, 125 from cry to cry, still giving him praise, 126 until the truth has won him over with more people.
query.result: 124 Swa dyde manega of Gittone yldran, 125 of gride to gride ðurh hine syllende lof, 126 oð ðæt ðæt soð hine hæfð oferwunnen mid ma manna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Or se tu hai sì ampio privilegio, 128 che licito ti sia l’andare al chiostro 129 nel quale è Cristo abate del collegio,
query.error: **English:** 127 Now if you have such ample privilege, 128 that it is permitted you to go to the cloister 129 in which Christ is abbot of the college,
query.result: 127 Nu ðu ðonne hæfst swa micelne anweald, 128 ðæt ðe alyfed sý ðæt ðu mote gangan to ðam clostre 129 ðær Crist is abbod ðæs geferscipes,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 falli per me un dir d’un paternostro, 131 quanto bisogna a noi di questo mondo, 132 dove poter peccar non è più nostro».
query.error: **English:** 130 say a paternoster for me, 131 as much as we need in this world, 132 where it is no longer in our power to sin."
query.result: 130 wyrc ðu ðær for me an paternoster, 131 swa micel swa us is neod on ðysse worulde, 132 ðær we ne moton syngian na mare."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Poi, forse per dar luogo altrui secondo 134 che presso avea, disparve per lo foco, 135 come per l’acqua il pesce andando al fondo.
query.error: **English:** 133 Then, perhaps to give place to another according 134 to what he had nearby, he disappeared through the fire, 135 as a fish through water, going to the bottom.
query.result: 133 Þa, mægðe forðgifan oðrum stede 134 swa swa he hæfde neah, he gewat ðurh ðone fyres, 135 swa fisc ðurh wæter, to grunde gewat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Io mi fei al mostrato innanzi un poco, 137 e dissi ch’al suo nome il mio disire 138 apparecchiava grazïoso loco.
query.error: **English:** 136 I made myself known to him a little, 137 and I said that my desire 138 was preparing a gracious place for his name.
query.result: 136 Ic me sylfne him cyðde lyt, 137 and cwæð ðæt min willa 138 him gearwode arfæste stowe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 El cominciò liberamente a dire: 140 «Tan m’abellis vostre cortes deman, 141 qu’ieu no me puesc ni voill a vos cobrire.
query.error: **English:** 139 He began to speak freely, saying: 140 "Your courteous request pleases me so much, 141 that I cannot and will not hide from you.
query.result: 139 He ða ongan ða freolice to sprecanne: 140 "Swa me ðin arwurde wilnung onhagiað, 141 ðæt ic ðe ne mæg ne ic ðe nelle hylan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Ieu sui Arnaut, que plor e vau cantan; 143 consiros vei la passada folor, 144 e vei jausen lo joi qu’esper, denan.
query.error: **English:** 142 I am Arnaut, who weeps and goes singing; 143 sorrowful I see the past folly, 144 and I see with joy the joy that I hope for, before me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 Ara vos prec, per aquella valor 146 que vos guida al som de l’escalina, 147 sovenha vos a temps de ma dolor!».
query.error: **English:** 145 Now I pray you, by that power 146 that guided you to the top of the stairway, 147 remember my suffering in time!».
query.result: 145 Nuicbiddeðic,ðurhdætmægenðæt 146 ðeðeðealæddetoðæshrofestope, 147 ðincsorgæðæmæðæðinretide!».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 Poi s’ascose nel foco che li affina.
query.error: **English:** 148 Then he hid himself in the fire that refines them.
query.result: 148 Þa he hine bewræp on ðam fyre ðe heom afanað.
